location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter to John Beaumont and George Green, Factors at Bushire from William Hornby, Daniel Draper, Thomas Hosym and Andrew Ramsay at Bombay Castle

physicalDescription.extent: The item is damaged and has several holes in its text.

mods.abstract: The letter discusses the supply and sales of woolens and cloth. It states that if the seige of Bussora [Basra] is raised then the Bombay Grabis to be sent there. It also states that extracts from the company' s commands are enclosed and confirms the payment of 4,000 rupees each to Beaumont and Green through their attorneys. Extracts from two offical company letters (dated 15 March 1775 and 12 April 1775) are enclosed along with an extract from an auditor of Indian accounts to the Council of Bombay (dated 12 April). Shipped by the Bombay Grab.
